text:
The Gujarat High Court on Wednesday issued notice to the State government and the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) on a public interest litigation petition (PIL) alleging that there was discrimination on religious grounds in providing civic amenities to different localities of the city.

A Division Bench issued notices to the Secretary, Urban Development, the Urban Housing Department of Gujarat, and the Municipal Commissioner of the AMC, seeking their replies within a month.

A PIL had been filed by NGO Jan Sangharsh Manch in this regard, in which it requested the court to direct the authorities to provide “basic civic amenities to residents of Muslim localities.”

The petitioner had approached the court claiming that the AMC did not respond to reminders sent to it to “provide basic amenities to residents of housing societies belonging to Muslim community ... situated in the Jodhpur Ward of Ahmedabad at the earliest.” — PTI
title: ‘Discrimination’ in amenities: HC notice to Gujarat
